task.summary:
Updated the models of Project and User.
- Gave Project model a reliable structure. Can modify as I go along. Remember to delete the database each time you change the model. Otherwise it will cause conflicts.
- ManyToMany relationship is established between Project and User and the field is added in the Project model. Intuition helps visualising this.
- Next : Get the github auth and add views and write those templates and add some style.

Changed the site model to 'user' and 'topic' as backbones, a cross between Quora and Reddit.
- Users can follow topics. Once they follow, they can post an idea in that topic. - Other users can show interest on the topic. Also they can upvote or downvote. - The creator has an idea which he can post to the topic.
~ This doesn't seem to be feasible model as it might result in other people plagiarising the ideas of OP and hence the OP will not be willing to share his idea with anyone else. - But he can post ideas, not to the topic, but in his own User page and this can go as a feed for other users and they can show interest.

Basic skeleton with a bit of Bootstrap to the user profile page.
Todo: - Adding appropriate views for feed, timeline and my story. - Adding follow functionality - Adding distinction between the logged_in user and other users. - Adding tags - Adding Github OAuth (will be pain)

Adding tags to the user by autocomplete...Done!
- Now I need to focus on the tabs of the user and what should be the content and how it should be. - One idea is to form a questionnaire so that it will be easy for people to write their content. - Designing the pages is going to be tough.
